revised_title: Exploring the Relationship between RNA Stability, Fitness, and Folding
tldr: The author investigates the relationship between the stability of replicative form and fitness among RNA variants transcribed by replicase. They find that stability in the replicative form of RNA molecules correlates with their self-interaction free energy and that replication rates are related to the thermodynamic stability of the replicative form. This study provides a sequence-dependent indicator of RNA fitness, which can be used to estimate the fitness of self-replicating RNA species based on their genome makeup.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > RNA Biology
